channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked drain flooding road, 9th February
item.description:
Blocked drain outside 72 Whaddon Road is flooded. Floods often, needs repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 9th February
item.description:
Pothole has been patched several times but keeps coming back. Always floods when it rains, and large traffic causes homes to shake. Holes are large enough to cause damage to vehicle suspension and causes cars to swerve.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approx 50 potholes in Caernarvon Road which are now very deep with loose stones being clipped by psssinh vehicles on, 9th February
item.description:
Many, many potholes now from Warden Hill Road to the end of Caernarvon Road of which are very deep and round, with loose stones being clipped by vehicles going through them and going onto pavements and possibly a passing cyclist! This has been reported many times! I understand the road is only being resurfaced up to Alma Road which is not far enough. I have just walked the length of it and lost count of them!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Flooded Again, 9th February
item.description:
Road flooded at Ham Brook Bridge again today
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Divider kerb between road and turning area has come loose and lifted up causing damage to cars and a trip hazard., 9th February
item.description:
Between numbers 26 and 53 the kerb in the road has come loose and is now sticking up causing a hazard. This has been present a few weeks since contractors vehicles were in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Springfield Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain outside The Nest, Battledown Approach completely blocked. Water flooding down pavement causing obstruction to pedestrians and school children walking to and from a holy Apostle’s school, 9th February
item.description:
Outside The Nest. By grass verge. Completely blocked with mud.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: After heavy rain (such as today) the pavement outside 8 Pittville Lawn and neighbouring buildings gets severely flooded, making it difficult to walk without getting wet. The pavement needs to be levelled out to avoid this. The nearby drains need clearing too., 9th February
item.description:
Outside 8 Pittville Lawn, Cheltenham GL52 2BD and neighbouring properties

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Pittville Lawn, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Flooding across doorway, 9th February
item.description:
Flooding across doorway of Food Pantry. I’m told that Highways dealt with this previously and as this is potentially affecting food pick ups and drop offs, it will be very much appreciated if this could be attended promptly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrove Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken, uneven, pot holed road, 9th February
item.description:
Withybridge Lane - road surface is in an appalling state. It forces drivers to take avoiding action. The whole stretch of road needs re-surfacing. The tarmac repairs that are carried out occasionally barely last a winter. SORT IT OUT ONCE and FOR ALL!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withybridge Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on A46 , Farm Lane to No 3., 9th February
item.description:
Flooding on the A46 Shurdindgton Road. Creating ri ers of water on both sides of the road. Vehicles are driving through the water creating waves covering the paths! Drainage is not coping with the rain water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 9th February
item.description:
LHM requests enquiry to be logged for tree inspector: There is very dangerous tree overhanging the road up to the burial ground – it is just below the section where ‘the Pines’ is located and belongs to GCC. Can you arrange works as necessary please
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop flooding. Danger to users who have to stand on road., 9th February
item.description:
Located at junction to cowley village on A435. Drain built last year but hasn’t been cleared. Bus users can’t access the shelter; have to stand on road - no lighting so exceptionally dangerous in the dark- causing danger to life. Have to stand in water for bus to pull off road and get soaked. Has been an issue all winter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 9th February
item.description:
There is a footpath which has been inaccessible for a number of years. We have brought this to the attention of Tewkesbury Borough council and Glos Footpaths in the past but had no luck in getting this reopened. It is the footpath which links Staverton village to Bamfurlong, near Staverton Airport. The old entrance to the path on the Gloucester Road B4063, is approximately where I have dropped the pin on the attached Google map. The property where the footpath has been closed off is Oaklands, owned by a Mr Gorman. There have been a number of planning issues with this property over the years and there are enforcements in place here, as well as a number of undetermined planning applications. I am not expecting an immediate resolution to this, but wondered what Glos Footpaths position is on this and if there is any action being considered. Yours hopefully. Bob Lewis
Report on FixMyStreet
